title: Jambalaya
summary: The recipe Jambalayan is ready in approximately 1 hour and 15 minutes and is definitely an awesome dairy free option for lovers of Creole food. This recipe serves 8. One portion of this dish contains about 23g of protein, 31g of fat, and a total of 609 calories. For $1.51 per serving, this recipe covers 16% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 5 people have made this recipe and would make it again. A mixture of beef broth, onion soup, meat [combination of sausage, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. To use up the rice you could follow this main course with the Rice Pudding as a dessert. Only a few people really liked this main course. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 49%. This score is pretty good. Similar recipes are One-Pot Jambalaya, Veg Jambalaya, and Jambalaya.

winePairing.pairingText: Cajun on the menu? Try pairing with Albarino, ros√© Wine, and Sauvignon Blanc. These low-tannin, lower alcohol wines will complement the heat in spicy cajun dishes, instead of making your mouth burn more. The The Fableist Albarino with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 19 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: The Fableist Albarino
productMatches.description: Bright peaches with a lemon-lime twist will invigorate you, as grapefruit encapsulates all your senses. Honeysuckle adds a round mid palate, while the bright acidity keeps the wine light and compliments the effervescence, perfect for relaxing as you float down the lazy river.
